name: The contribution of databases to the results of systematic reviews: a cross-sectional study
description: We conducted a cross-sectional quantitative analysis to examine the impact of selective database searching on results of meta-analyses. Our sample included systematic reviews with at least one meta-analysis from three Cochrane Review Groups.

citation.text: Hartling L, Featherstone RM, Nuspl M, Shave K, Dryden D, & Vandermeer B. (2016). The contribution of databases to the results of systematic reviews: a cross-sectional study. BMC Medical Research Methodology. [In review].

license.text: Permission from the Alberta Research Centre for Health Evidence (ARCHE) is required to download data files for this project. Attribution is required for use of the data with the statement: The authors acknowledge the Alberta Research Centre (ARCHE) at the University of Alberta for collecting and sharing the data analyzed for this work.

distribution.name: ARI_DBs.xlsx
distribution.description: Presence of trials in databases contributing to Cochrane meta-analyses for the Acute Respiratory Infections (ARI) review group.

distribution.name: DPLP_DBs.xlsx
distribution.description: Presence of trials in databases contributing to Cochrane meta-analyses for the Developmental Psychosocial and Learning Problems (DPLP) review group.

distribution.name: InfectiousDiseases_DBs.xlsx
distribution.description: Presence of trials in databases contributing to Cochrane meta-analyses for the Infectious Diseases (ID) review group.
